Key Match Events: José Suarez allowed three runs over five frames in a 4-3 loss in 10 innings to the White Sox.
Korey Lee hit a two-run homer in the second inning.
Lenyn Sosa hit a go-ahead solo blast in the fourth inning.
The Angels tied the game in the eighth inning with a successful squeeze play.
Taylor Ward grounded into a double play with the go-ahead run at third base.
The Angels hit into three critical double plays late in the game.
Post-Match Reflections: José Suarez expressed confidence in his performance and readiness for next year.
Angels manager Ron Washington commented on Suarez's performance, noting that he battled and kept the team in the ballgame.
Ron Washington reflected on Zach Neto's mistakes, attributing them to youth and inexperience.
Ron Washington mentioned the team's missed offensive opportunities due to hitting into double plays.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The White Sox are one defeat away from setting the record of 121 losses in a season.
Zach Neto made two costly base-running mistakes and a throwing error.
